content.body: There's a WhatWG, CSSWG and OpenUI CG joint taskforce that happens, and it's happening atm, was just a ping to remind those as attendance is lwo
jarhar: aha, if we already expose the error message that way (had totally forgetten it), then I'd prefer the element based approach
content.formatted_body: jarhar: aha, if we already expose the error message that way (had totally forgetten it), then I'd prefer the element based approach

content.body: smaug: as the discussion in https://github.com/whatwg/html/pull/11345 continues, im caring less and less about this edge case. if you feel strongly that the existing spec is good enough, i could be convined to drop the PR. i still think that making CommandEvent not composed is a good idea. what do you think we should do?
content.formatted_body: smaug: as the discussion in https://github.com/whatwg/html/pull/11345 continues, im caring less and less about this edge case. if you feel strongly that the existing spec is good enough, i could be convined to drop the PR. i still think that making CommandEvent not composed is a good idea. what do you think we should do?

content.body: Not sure how to expose the message in the popup though. Modifying DOM is a bit weird (and done only by customizable select currently, I think)
